name: city_address
businessSemantics: zip code of the address in the city

original.question: What is the zip code of the address in the city Port Chelsea?
original.query: SELECT zip_postcode FROM Addresses WHERE city  =  'Port Chelsea'

name: department_degree_count
businessSemantics: department offering the most number of degrees

original.question: Which department offers the most number of degrees? List department name and id.
original.query: SELECT T2.department_name ,  T1.department_id FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Departments AS T2 ON T1.department_id  =  T2.department_id GROUP BY T1.department_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: department_with_most_degrees
businessSemantics: name and id of the department with the most number of degrees

original.question: What is the name and id of the department with the most number of degrees ?
original.query: select t2.department_name ,  t1.department_id from degree_programs as t1 join departments as t2 on t1.department_id  =  t2.department_id group by t1.department_id order by count(*) desc limit 1

name: department_offering_degree
businessSemantics: count of departments offering any degree

original.question: How many departments offer any degree?
original.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT department_id) FROM Degree_Programs

name: department_offering_degrees
businessSemantics: count of different departments offering degrees

original.question: How many different departments offer degrees?
original.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT department_id) FROM Degree_Programs

name: engineering_department_degrees
businessSemantics: count of degrees in the engineering department

original.question: How many degrees does the engineering department have?
original.query: SELECT count(*) FROM Departments AS T1 JOIN Degree_Programs AS T2 ON T1.department_id  =  T2.department_id WHERE T1.department_name  =  'engineer'

name: course_information
businessSemantics: names and id of courses with at most 2 sections

original.question: What are the names and id of courses having at most 2 sections?
original.query: SELECT T1.course_name ,  T1.course_id FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Sections AS T2 ON T1.course_id  =  T2.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_id HAVING count(*)  <=  2

name: course_with_less_than_2_sections
businessSemantics: names and ids of every course with less than 2 sections

original.question: What are the names and ids of every course with less than 2 sections?
original.query: SELECT T1.course_name ,  T1.course_id FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Sections AS T2 ON T1.course_id  =  T2.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_id HAVING count(*)  <=  2

name: most_registered_semester
businessSemantics: semester with the most student registrations

original.question: What is the semester which most student registered in? Show both the name and the id.
original.query: SELECT T1.semester_name ,  T1.semester_id FROM Semesters AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.semester_id  =  T2.semester_id GROUP BY T1.semester_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: semester_with_most_students
businessSemantics: name and id of the semester with the most students registered

original.question: For each semester, what is the name and id of the one with the most students registered?
original.query: SELECT T1.semester_name ,  T1.semester_id FROM Semesters AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.semester_id  =  T2.semester_id GROUP BY T1.semester_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: student_enrollment
businessSemantics: students enrolled in 2 degree programs in one semester

original.question: What are the first, middle, and last names, along with the ids, of all students who enrolled in 2 degree programs in one semester?
original.query: SELECT T1.first_name ,  T1.middle_name ,  T1.last_name ,  T1.student_id FROM Students AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.student_id GROUP BY T1.student_id HAVING count(*)  =  2

name: degree_program_popularity
businessSemantics: most enrolled program kind

original.question: Find the kind of program which most number of students are enrolled in?
original.query: SELECT T1.degree_summary_name FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id GROUP BY T1.degree_summary_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: degree_summary
businessSemantics: degree summary name with the most number of students enrolled

original.question: What is the degree summary name that has the most number of students enrolled?
original.query: SELECT T1.degree_summary_name FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id GROUP BY T1.degree_summary_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: most_enrolled_program
businessSemantics: program with the highest number of enrolled students

original.question: Find the program which most number of students are enrolled in. List both the id and the summary.
original.query: SELECT T1.degree_program_id ,  T1.degree_summary_name FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id GROUP BY T1.degree_program_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: degree_program_enrollment
businessSemantics: program id and summary of the degree with the most students enrolled

original.question: What is the program id and the summary of the degree that has the most students enrolled?
original.query: SELECT T1.degree_program_id ,  T1.degree_summary_name FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id GROUP BY T1.degree_program_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: student_enrollment
businessSemantics: student with the most enrollments

original.question: Which student has enrolled for the most times in any program? List the id, first name, middle name, last name, the number of enrollments and student id.
original.query: SELECT T1.student_id ,  T1.first_name ,  T1.middle_name ,  T1.last_name ,  count(*) ,  T1.student_id FROM Students AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.student_id  =  T2.student_id GROUP BY T1.student_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: unenrolled_semesters
businessSemantics: semesters without student enrollment

original.question: Which semesters do not have any student enrolled? List the semester name.
original.query: SELECT semester_name FROM Semesters WHERE semester_id NOT IN( SELECT semester_id FROM Student_Enrolment )

name: semester_with_no_students
businessSemantics: name of the semester with no students enrolled

original.question: What is the name of the semester with no students enrolled?
original.query: SELECT semester_name FROM Semesters WHERE semester_id NOT IN( SELECT semester_id FROM Student_Enrolment )

name: enrolled_courses
businessSemantics: course names with students enrolled

original.question: What are all the course names of the courses which ever have students enrolled in?
original.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.course_name FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment_Courses AS T2 ON T1.course_id  =  T2.course_id

name: enrolled_courses
businessSemantics: names of all courses with students enrolled

original.question: What are the names of all courses that have some students enrolled?
original.query: SELECT DISTINCT T1.course_name FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment_Courses AS T2 ON T1.course_id  =  T2.course_id

name: course_name
businessSemantics: name of the course with most number of enrollments

original.question: What's the name of the course with most number of enrollments?
original.query: SELECT  T1.course_name FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment_Courses AS T2 ON T1.course_id  =  T2.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: most_enrolled_course
businessSemantics: name of the course with the most students enrolled

original.question: What is the name of the course with the most students enrolled?
original.query: SELECT  T1.course_name FROM Courses AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment_Courses AS T2 ON T1.course_id  =  T2.course_id GROUP BY T1.course_name ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: student_last_name
businessSemantics: last name of students in North Carolina not registered in any degree programs

original.question: What are the last name of the students who live in North Carolina but have not registered in any degree programs?
original.query: SELECT T1.last_name FROM Students AS T1 JOIN Addresses AS T2 ON T1.current_address_id  =  T2.address_id WHERE T2.state_province_county  =  'NorthCarolina' EXCEPT SELECT DISTINCT T3.last_name FROM Students AS T3 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T4 ON T3.student_id  =  T4.student_id

name: transcript_details
businessSemantics: date and id of the transcript with at least 2 course results

original.question: Show the date and id of the transcript with at least 2 course results.
original.query: SELECT T2.transcript_date ,  T1.transcript_id FROM Transcript_Contents AS T1 JOIN Transcripts AS T2 ON T1.transcript_id  =  T2.transcript_id GROUP BY T1.transcript_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2

name: transcript_details
businessSemantics: date and id of the transcript with at least 2 courses listed

original.question: What is the date and id of the transcript with at least 2 courses listed?
original.query: SELECT T2.transcript_date ,  T1.transcript_id FROM Transcript_Contents AS T1 JOIN Transcripts AS T2 ON T1.transcript_id  =  T2.transcript_id GROUP BY T1.transcript_id HAVING count(*)  >=  2

name: most_students_address
businessSemantics: address with the most number of students

original.question: Which address holds the most number of students currently? List the address id and all lines.
original.query: SELECT T1.address_id ,  T1.line_1 ,  T1.line_2 FROM Addresses AS T1 JOIN Students AS T2 ON T1.address_id  =  T2.current_address_id GROUP BY T1.address_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: address_with_most_students
businessSemantics: id, line 1, and line 2 of the address with the most students

original.question: What is the id, line 1, and line 2 of the address with the most students?
original.query: SELECT T1.address_id ,  T1.line_1 ,  T1.line_2 FROM Addresses AS T1 JOIN Students AS T2 ON T1.address_id  =  T2.current_address_id GROUP BY T1.address_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: student_course_enrollment
businessSemantics: maximum times a course enrollment appears in transcripts

original.question: How many times at most can a course enrollment result show in different transcripts? Also show the course enrollment id.
original.query: SELECT count(*) ,  student_course_id FROM Transcript_Contents GROUP BY student_course_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: student_course_enrollment
businessSemantics: maximum number of times a course shows up in different transcripts

original.question: What is the maximum number of times that a course shows up in different transcripts and what is that course's enrollment id?
original.query: SELECT count(*) ,  student_course_id FROM Transcript_Contents GROUP BY student_course_id ORDER BY count(*) DESC LIMIT 1

name: transcript_date_least_results
businessSemantics: date of the transcript with the least number of results

original.question: Show the date of the transcript which shows the least number of results, also list the id.
original.query: SELECT T2.transcript_date ,  T1.transcript_id FROM Transcript_Contents AS T1 JOIN Transcripts AS T2 ON T1.transcript_id  =  T2.transcript_id GROUP BY T1.transcript_id ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

name: transcript_least_results
businessSemantics: date and id of the transcript with the least number of results

original.question: What is the date and id of the transcript with the least number of results?
original.query: SELECT T2.transcript_date ,  T1.transcript_id FROM Transcript_Contents AS T1 JOIN Transcripts AS T2 ON T1.transcript_id  =  T2.transcript_id GROUP BY T1.transcript_id ORDER BY count(*) ASC LIMIT 1

name: enrollment_semester
businessSemantics: semester when both Master and Bachelor students got enrolled

original.question: Find the semester when both Master students and Bachelor students got enrolled in.
original.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.semester_id FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id WHERE degree_summary_name  =  'Master' INTERSECT SELECT DISTINCT T2.semester_id FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id WHERE degree_summary_name  =  'Bachelor'

name: semester_id_with_both_degrees
businessSemantics: id of the semester with both Masters and Bachelors students enrolled

original.question: What is the id of the semester that had both Masters and Bachelors students enrolled?
original.query: SELECT DISTINCT T2.semester_id FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id WHERE degree_summary_name  =  'Master' INTERSECT SELECT DISTINCT T2.semester_id FROM Degree_Programs AS T1 JOIN Student_Enrolment AS T2 ON T1.degree_program_id  =  T2.degree_program_id WHERE degree_summary_name  =  'Bachelor'

name: student_addresses
businessSemantics: count of unique student addresses

original.question: How many different addresses do the students currently live?
original.query: SELECT count(DISTINCT current_address_id) FROM Students

name: student_details
businessSemantics: student details in reversed lexicographical order

original.question: List all the student details in reversed lexicographical order.
original.query: SELECT other_student_details FROM Students ORDER BY other_student_details DESC
